news_header: US Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth paid $50,000 for a non-disclosure agreement related to sexual abuse accusations.
news_text: Pete Hegseth, the US Secretary of Defense, disclosed to the Senate Committee that he paid $50,000 to a woman who accused him of sexual abuse. He has denied the allegations from the 2017 case. President Donald Trump has nominated Hegseth, a former Fox News host, for the position, with a Senate vote scheduled for Friday.
